div.p: When an agency locates a record as the result of a FOIA request,
that contains information of interest to another agency,
the other agency must review the record before it can be released.
This process where an agency sends a record to another agency for review is called a consultation.
Consultations are tracked in the same way that requests are on FOIA.Gov.
When running a report on consultations, you can see how many consultations
are currently in the backlog at an agency at the beginning of the fiscal year,
how many are received, how many are re-processed, and how many are pending at the end of the fiscal year.
